wikipedia_page.main:
William Henry Johnson  (15 October 1890 – 25 April 1945) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.
He was 27 years old, and on 3 October 1918 at Ramicourt, France, he performed the deed for which he was awarded the VC.

response: *William Henry Johnson (1890-1945), recipient of a Victoria Cross
* Zip the Pinhead (William Henry Johnson, 1842–1926), circus entertainer
* William Henry Johnson (VC) (1890–1945), English recipient of the Victoria Cross
* William Henry Johnson (World War I soldier) (1892-1929), American recipient of the Purple Heart and Medal of Honor
* William Henry Johnson (valet) (died 1864), President Abraham Lincoln's barber and valet

* Sergeant William Henry Johnson (VC), First World War
*(1890–1945) William Henry Johnson, awarded the Victoria Cross for valour at Ramicourt, France, in the First World War in 1918, was born at Worksop and died in Arnold.

response: William Henry Johnson is the name of:
*William Henry Johnson (valet) (died 1864), part-time valet and barber to Abraham Lincoln
*William Henry Johnson (VC) (1890–1945), English First World War recipient of the Victoria Cross
*Henry Johnson (World War I soldier) (born William Henry Johnson, 1892–1929), American First World War recipient of the Medal of Honor
*William Johnson (artist) (born William Henry Johnson, 1901–1970), African-American painter
